articles.author: Li Cohen
articles.title: Asia just had a deadly heat wave, and scientists say it could happen again. Here's what's making it much more likely. - CBS News
articles.description: Extreme heat is known as a "silent killer," and in some areas across Asia, its intensity would have been impossible without one critical factor, a new study found.
articles.content:
Hundreds of people died across Asia in recent weeks as the region sweltered under blistering temperatures. And a new study determined a leading factor in how it all happened. 
Last month, many areas… [+5437 chars]
